DefaultDialogue: It is very hard to believe this dismal forest was once a happy place.\n\nSo much that was good is gone.
I hoped time would bring new life to Brightwood, but it remains as dreary as it was two centuries ago.\n\nThe Order was long gone by the time the darkness descended here.

Many of the king's knights joined the Orderâ€¦ but of course, you know what happened to them.\n\nGalahad remained at Artorius's side, and now that I hear the name, I do recall hearing he resurfaced after the war.
Ah, it is good to see you, young Warden. I have bad news - I found a large force of Corrupted to the east.\n\nSer Galahad has informed me that Corruption has claimed the Manor as well.
If you can defeat their Commander, it will weaken the Corrupted's hold here.

The ranger already scouted the extent of the territory the Corrupted have claimed.\n\nShe believes their only goal is to collect resources for their war machine, but I suspect a more sinister purpose.

In my most dire estimations, I could not have imagined how desperate the situation has become.\n\nA few years ago, the Great Cleave was quiet, safe. But now the Corrupted appear to have total dominion.
I am going to focus every moment on recruiting new Soulwardens. One thing is certain - we cannot do this alone.
I am going to focus every moment on recruiting new Soulwardens. One thing is certain - we cannot do this alone.

Welcome back, Warden. If I had known the difficulty in claiming the fortress, I might've thought twice.\n\nHowever, I understand it was Umberto's actions that cursed these grounds, and somehow, he was the last one standing?

Welcome back, Warden. If I had known the difficulty in claiming the fortress, I might've thought twice.\n\nHowever, I understand it was Umberto's actions that cursed these grounds, and somehow, he was the last one standing?
If this works, I think we'll have a fine fortress for the new Order.

You, on the other hand, have no such luxury. You've been quiet, but I can tell the voice of the Tempest still speaks to you.\n\nYou are connected through the Pure Azoth you were exposed to, and Corruption's drive to claim it.
More and more brave young souls join our ranks each day.\n\nWe may yet return to the numbers we had so long ago.
Travel safely, friend.\n\nWhile in the Brightwood, I suggest you stay on the road and avoid traveling at night.

Be wary, traveler. A great tragedy has occurred here. The good people who lived in these hills have fallen and turned into soulless Lost.\n\nIf you've come seeking family or an old friend, I fear your journey may be in vain.

Yes, friend. You are now acquainted with my regretful decision to abandon Umberto and go on a fruitless quest to find the king.\n\nMy only desire now is to atone for my mistakes, but I am not sure where to begin.

What matters most, however, is that we're united in seeking Brother Umberto.\n\nTo me, it's clear: the darkness consuming the Brightwood is the Lost. Umberto and I swore to fight it, and I will honor that oath.

What matters most, however, is that we're united in seeking Brother Umberto.\n\nTo me, it's clear: the darkness consuming the Brightwood is the Lost. Umberto and I swore to fight it, and I will honor that oath.

Glad you're here - the old man seems quite disturbed, but your presence will reassure him.\n\nIn regards to Umberto, I found references to the Bright Vigil relocating to a more defensible location. I might even know where.

Glad you're here - the old man seems quite disturbed, but your presence will reassure him.\n\nIn regards to Umberto, I found references to the Bright Vigil relocating to a more defensible location. I might even know where.
Have no fear. If I find Umberto, you will be first to know.
I have been inquiring around town whether anyone here was a witness to the Vigil's fall.\n\nBut when I saw Yonas, I knew it was my duty to make amends to you both.

I'm afraid I haven't been quite so successful. The only thing I've learned is that Umberto hasn't been seen for years.\n\nThe people of Calvary are strangely quiet when the subject of the Bright Vigil comes up.

I will go and speak to the Mayor myself. In the meantime, it would seem there are still questions as to Umberto's ultimate fate.\n\nDid Pennyfather give you any leads to follow? Someone who may know more?
Fortuitous timing, my friend. You catch me on the verge of traveling into Weaver's Fen to inquire about Umberto.\n\nPennyfather was adamant that I'd find answers there.
I have not visited the Fen since the Wars of Crimson Madness. Those are not fond memories.
After all we've learned, I presumed Umberto had long since fallen Lost. It would have been a just fate.\n\nBut no, I confronted him myself, and to my horror, his humanity has somehow been preserved.

Iâ€¦ must apologize. I judged the Wardens unfairly, perhaps during the Crimson Madness, but most certainly now.\n\nYou've proven the order is honorable and strong. With the Corrupted returning, I salute your courage in facing it.

Iâ€¦ must apologize. I judged the Wardens unfairly, perhaps during the Crimson Madness, but most certainly now.\n\nYou've proven the order is honorable and strong. With the Corrupted returning, I salute your courage in facing it.
I've given the matter some thought, and I decided to take you on your offer.

It seems providence has already seen fit to verify I made the right choice in coming.\n\nI hear this talk of the sorceress with the purple eye, and I believe we have another quest to undertake together.
We were so naÃ¯ve when we arrived on these shores.\n\nWe actually believed this accursed island held the promise of Avalon.
Always a treat to see a new face in Calvary, but I have no time to talk right now.\n\nIt's quite taxing to run this town, you know.
God's ears! Tell me you're not here to talk about missing priests, cursed forts, or the damned Bright Vigil.\n\nWill you people never stop? Why can't I get any peace?
Now I've already told you more than I should have. Let me be!

I see that look in your eyeâ€¦ whatever you found up there, I had nothing to do with it!\n\nThe atrocities Umberto and the Vigilants committed against those poor, innocent familiesâ€¦ it's simply unthinkable.
If you wish to see me punished for my silence, I accept it.\n\nI have nothing to say in my defense.

You again? No, please! I have nothing more to confess! You've already exposed my secret shame!\n\nAnd I understand you managed to lure Sun away on some crazy enterprise. What more can you take from me?
Go on, read the book, though it might give you a fright!

There now, you know the full story! Whatever terrible deeds you attribute to the Bright Vigil, they were victims too.\n\nTell me though - do you mean to track down the vile crone and hold her to account?
I thought you were going to Weaver's Fenâ€¦ good riddance, I say!
I saw the old man poking around here. Whatever crusade you're involved in, I want no part of it.

Well now, imagine finding the only other sane person on this island, here in this accursed place!\n\nI heard this "Bright Vigil" amassed quite a fortune before they up and vanished. They left a stain of evil as well.

Now we're talkingâ€¦ I see you found some shinies. Don't forget - all this is going toward buying a boat to get off this crazy rock.\n\nI suppose you're more interested in hearing about this curse, though, aren't you?
I saw the old man poking around here. Whatever crusade you're involved in, I want no part of it.
Well now, we got a right crowd hanging about this place.\n\nDon't get me wrong, I'm not here to stay, but I'm glad to think we've found a safe spot from all the evils lurking on this damned island.
Even shrouded in darkness, there is beauty in Brightwood.\n\nIf you know where to find it.

If the mayor sent you to nag me about his invitation to tea, please give him my regrets.\n\nI don't have the interest or the time for social engagements, especially when he requests I work alone and keep everything so secret.
I have my part in this as well. I'll explain after Brightrest.
Removing the curse from Caer Dun will take more than just seeing the Vigil's crimes avenged.\n\nWe'll need the healing power of the earth itself.

There is somethingâ€¦ different about you, I think. You were touched somehow by the Tree, weren't you?\n\nDon't worry - I won't pry.  We want to remove the curse from Caer Dun, and now, we have the waters.
Be careful. The Grand Vigilant is as dark as they come.

You were just in time to interrupt Yonas sharing another tale of your exploits. Not that I wasn't enjoying them, of course.\n\nBut I'm keen to take a shot at removing this curse! Assuming you have the "Heartgem," are you ready?

You were just in time to interrupt Yonas sharing another tale of your exploits. Not that I wasn't enjoying them, of course.\n\nBut I'm keen to take a shot at removing this curse! Assuming you have the "Heartgem," are you ready?
Whatever you have to face down there, I have no doubt you can handle it.
I must admit, I really wasn't sure this would work, but look at this place!\n\nI'd say it's as pristine as the day it was built. You and I make a good team.
I must admit, I really wasn't sure this would work, but look at this place!\n\nI'd say it's as pristine as the day it was built. You and I make a good team.
If I'm being honest, I'm a bit jealous of you getting a vision from the Azoth Tree.
I will stay here and help Yonas. I think he needs it.

Etched into the gravestone reads:

For Ysabel Arias, whose soul faded along with her beauty

An offering plate lies below.

Etched into the gravestone reads:

For Ysabel Arias, whose soul faded along with her beauty

An offering plate lies below.

Writing is roughly chiseled into the gravestone:

Rajesh Malhotra held too tightly to a family he left behind

An offering plate lies below.

Writing is roughly chiseled into the gravestone:

Rajesh Malhotra held too tightly to a family he left behind

An offering plate lies below.

In a thinly carved script, the gravestone reads:

Liang Ji was a hunter like no other, until their luck ran out

An offering plate lies below.

In a thinly carved script, the gravestone reads:

Liang Ji was a hunter like no other, until their luck ran out

An offering plate lies below.
